roleset.name: act, work

example.name: Example with args 0, 1, and 2. Note arg 1 is a job/role filled
example.text: animalcare services manager for the SPCA

example.name: example with arg 1, where security is a job

roleset.note: Roleset based on serve.01. Verbnet class masquerade-29.6. Framed by Katie.

example.name: Example with args 0 and 1
example.text: His exemplary service as Secretary of Commerce

roleset.name: provide, give

example.name: Example with arg 1 and 2. Arg 1 is a thing provided rather than a job/role needing to be filled.
example.text: a company that provides disaster recovery services for computer-dependent businesses

example.name: Example with arg 0 and 2
example.text: an obligation of government service for all young people

roleset.note: Roleset based on serve.02. No corresponding vn class. Framed by Katie.

roleset.name: religious service or ceremony

role.descr: explicit mention of entity honored at the service

example.name: Example with arg 1 as religious service
example.text: Thirty-five percent attend religious services regularly

example.name: example with arg 1 and 2
example.text: More than 100 people their wedding service .

roleset.note: Roleset loosely based on celebrate.01. Verbnet class judgement-33. Framed by Katie.

predicate.note: Choosing between service.01 and service.01 can be confusing. If it is a job or a role that is being filled, it should be service.01. If it is a service you are recieving, it is service.02. Hint: if there is a recipient or a 'service to' it is probably service.02.
